personalInfo.clubAffl: Club Bartolomé Mitre de Pérez (Rosario, Argentina)

tourBios.curYrHigh: Earned conditional status on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica with a T13 finish at the Buenos Aires, Argentina Q-School in January.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Dominated the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica Q-School in Buenos Aires, Argentina with rounds of 64-68-66- to lead all the way to finish at 266 (-14) and claim medalist honors by six strokes at Hurlingham Club... Had three top-25s and nine cuts made in 17 starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica to finish the season ranked 75th on the Order of Merit... His best finish was T17 at the Hyundai-BBVA Abierto de Chile in October.

2014: Made the cut in 8 of his 17 starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, with his top finishes being T23 at the Lexus Peru Open and T26 at the Hyundai – BBVA Abierto de Chile in November. Finished the season ranked 95th on the Order of Merit. Remained the youngest Tour member for the third consecutive season.

2013: The day he turned 18, he carded a final-round 67 (-5) to finish T2 at the Qualifying Tournament in Lima, Peru to claim back his PGA TOUR Latinoamérica card… Remained the youngest Tour member for the second consecutive season… Finished the season ranked 95th on the Order of Merit after a season of five cuts made in 14 starts, with a T11 finish at the 82nd Abierto OSDE del Centro in Cordoba, Argentina as his only top-25… A T9 finish at the Developmental Series Final Samsung Tournament in Lima, Peru in December secured him conditional status for the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica 2014 season.

2012: Made his debut as a professional and a PGA TOUR Latinoamérica member at the Roberto De Vicenzo Invitational Copa NEC in October. Posted rounds of 75 and 74 to miss the cut… Missed the cut in all of his six Tour starts… Earned conditional status on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica by finishing 21st at the Qualifying School at Hurlingham Club in Argentina, where he lost a playoff for the 20th spot to his fellow countryman and amateur Jorge Fernández Valdés… Finished seventh at the Argentine Tour's Ángel Cabrera Classic in December.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won the 2010 Doral Publix Junior Golf Classic (Boys 14-15) in Miami, Florida… Finished first on the 2010-2011 Argentine Amateur Ranking… Won the 2011 South American Amateur Championship in Bucaramanga, Colombia.
tourBios.personal: Gustavo Romero is the only coach he has ever had… The Old Course at St. Andrews and Teeth of the Dog in the Dominican Republic are his favorite golf courses to play… Considers himself a big soccer fan and his favorite professional team is Rosario Central… The Argentinean style asado is his favorite meal… Juan Martín del Potro is his favorite athlete to watch… Tiger Woods, Jack Nicklaus and Ángel Cabrera would round out his dreamed foursome… New York is his favorite city… Twitter name is @francoromero72… Instagram name is @franromero72

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was T11th in 2013 at the 82 Abierto OSDE del Centro.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T34th in Par Breakers on the Latinoamérica.
